hackathon-description-text: It is clear that the Internet of Things presents great opportunities as well as technical and commercial challenges.  The Innovation Catalyst and its partners are running HackIoT to allow students, entrepreneurs and professionals to;
hackathon-requirements:
Individuals attending will be placed in teams.  We will expect teams to present a solution to a challenge and a business case at the end of HackIoT in a 3min presentation.  You will present your open source* LoRaWAN IoT project to judges, that will be shared with global IoT houses. (* open source using the standard MIT License)
Familarize yourself with these technologies:

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: UTC/School winning team all take home a devkit each
UoR/Student winning team all take home a devkit each
Professional winning team all take home a devkit each
Overall team winner gets a place on the Barclays Eagle Lab Flight Accelerator Programme

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=1 Collegiate Square, South Ave, Shinfield RG2 9LH, United Kingdom

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion: Projects must integrate the full hardware/software stacks: Microshare, SODAQ Explorer device, LoRaWAN, The Things Network
A valid business proposition and commercial rationale should be explained
An attempt should be made to identify and indicate the scale of the market opportunity - Who will one day pay and why.

hackathon-location-address: 1 Collegiate Square, South Ave, Shinfield RG2 9LH, United Kingdom
hackathon-description-header: The Internet of Things will change lives, create new businesses & develop new opportunities. LoRaWAN is set to be a key standard. Get involved in the opportunity at HackIoT Reading UK.
